Funnily enough women not wearing a top is legal in 33 usa states.  When you get down to it the people that think it "should be legal" don't actually know usa law and are instead trying to make it the norm.  When you get down to it the only states where it's explicitly illegal are Indiana, Utah and Tennessee.

Tl:dr; women being topless is legal in most of the usa.

topics.body:
"@Albus Fahrenheits":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55a6f4ab63687226b90030e4#post_55a6f4ab63687226b90030e4
You should hear the some weird fucking laws in the usa.

In Colorado it's a felony to hug a child.

West Virginia it was for a long time illegal for two adults living together unmarried to have sex.

In Tennessee it's illegal for students to hold hands.

In Texas it's illegal to own more than six dildos.

In South Carolina if a man promises to marry a woman and they sleep together if they don't get married that's a crime.

In Pennsylvania oral and anal sex is a crime.

Nebraska it's illegal to get married if you have gonorrhea, hiv or hepatitis or such you can though.

Mississippi premarital sex is illegal.

topics.body:
"@Virgil Stormblade":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55a6f7d46368726df200097d#post_55a6f7d46368726df200097d
Most of the laws aren't enforced fortunately.

When you get down to it a lot of laws aren't enforced.  The reason why a fuck ton of usa laws aren't enforced is that the justice department, nor local police departments have the capability to enforce a lot of laws.

What I mean by this is that from a legal perspective you would think the usa is 1984, but in reality the reason why it's not is because on the local level a lot of smaller cities pay for their bills with car tickets or such cause the states are strapped for cash all the time cause the national government foots the bill for national programs by dumping everything on the states; the states in turn have to pay for national programs and take care of their own shit as well.



What is probably going to cause the usa in the long run to become extremist anti-authoritarian in practice is self driving cars.  The reason being is that the way individual cities a lot of the time pay to put people in prison is by footing the bill with car tickets, that's why your average car ticket is flipping expensive, if there's no more car tickets then local governments literally can not afford to put anyone in prison except for violent criminals anymore.

It's just a guess, but considering how much of local governments pay for jails with car tickets that's going to be a paradigm shift with self driving cars.
"@hype":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55a6fb1b6368720f930024a5#post_55a6fb1b6368720f930024a5
Correction: legal in 10 states; misdemeanor in a lot of states.
